alert.note: Alert for Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 4:12PM CDT until May 14 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following area, Winnebago. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy showers with rain rates of over one inch in 30 minutes. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Street flooding is imminent or may already be occurring in the Rockford area. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Rockford, Loves Park, and Machesney Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
